1.text: Cut 3 metres (9.8 ft) of cord into 3 equal parts.

2.text: Separate each length of cord and lay them parallel to each other.

3.text: Tie a loose knot about 5 inches (13 cm) to 6 inches (15 cm) down.

4.text: Tape the knotted side onto a table to hold it in place.

5.text: Separate each cord so they resemble a small teepee.

6.text: Place cord 1 over the top of cords 2 and 3.

7.text: Put cord 3 back over the top of cord 1.

8.text: Run the end of cord 3 through the loop made by cords 1 and 2.

9.text: Pick up cords 1 and 3 and pull them tight to form a knot.

10.text: Repeat the same process but run the cords underneath.

12.text: Thread a bead onto the middle cord (cord 2).

13.text: Tie the next square knot right under the bead.

14.text: Make 2 more square knots until it's time to add the next bead.

15.text: Finish the other end-side of the bracelet as you began.

16.text: Tie off the bracelet after you’ve tied the last square knot.

17.text: Place a dab of glue onto each side of the knot.

18.text: Cut off the 2 outer cords to the base of the glued knot.

19.text: Cut the 2 ends down until they’re the same size.

20.text: Place a 1 metre (3.3 ft) long cord under the 2 bracelet cords.

22.text: Make about 5 more loose square knots and tie it off.

23.text: Cut off the ends to leave 1 cord on each side of the square knots.

24.text: Add a final bead to each end of the 2 loose cords and cut the extra off.
